summary: This is an email chain from May 26, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the creation of video clips from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos for the Epstein investigation. The emails coordinate which staff member should handle the task and provide instructions for extracting specific question-and-answer sequences.

persons.name: Urbanczyk, Peter
persons.context: Appears as a recipient/copied on an email regarding the creation of video clips from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her deposition videos are the subject of the email; specific clips are to be extracted from her testimony for use in the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Peter Urbanczyk (contractor) is tasked with working on video evidence from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Coordination for Maxwell deposition video clips
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff coordinate via email to have specific video clips created from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos for the Epstein investigation.

locations: Usa.doj.gov \ cloud \NYS StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018R01618 InvestigationVI 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena tR a , third subpoena response Videos
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively working on the Epstein investigation as of May 2020, specifically processing evidence from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition.
Video deposition testimony of Ghislaine Maxwell existed and was being reviewed and clipped for specific question-and-answer sequences.
The email indicates internal coordination between AUSAs and staff/contractors (like Peter Urbanczyk) to handle multimedia evidence.
The document references a specific investigation folder path for evidence related to 'USvEpstein-2018R01618'.
The task involved extracting approximately 11 specific Q&A sequences with contextual video before and after each exchange.
